io.github.utk003.util.data.singleton

Class SingletonFactory<S extends Singleton<S,F>,F extends SingletonFactory<S,F>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.utk003.util.data.singleton.SingletonFactory<S,F>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The class type of the singleton this class creates
    F - The class type of the singleton factory this class represents
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrayedSingletonFactory, ClassWrappedSingletonFactory, MappedSingletonFactory

    @ScheduledForRelease(inVersion="v2.3.0")
public abstract class SingletonFactory<S extends Singleton<S,F>,F extends SingletonFactory<S,F>>
extends Object
    A factory for Singleton.
    Since:
    2.3.0
    Version:
    July 26, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)
    See Also:
    Singleton

    • Method Detail

      • currentValues

        @NotNull
public S[] currentValues()
        Returns an array of all singletons currently defined through this factory.

        This is equivalent to 

        values.toArray((S[]) new Singleton[]).
        Returns:
        An array of all singletons currently defined through this factory

      • values

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Set<S> values()
        Returns a dynamically-updating, modifiable Set of all singletons defined by this factory.

        As the returned set is both dynamically-updating and modifiable, changes to the set will be reflected in this factory. As a result, the set's Set.remove(Object) can be used to "un-define" singletons. However, singletons cannot be added to the factory in this way.

        Returns:
        A dynamic, mutable set of singletons defined by this factory

      • get

        @Nullable
public S get(@NotNull
                       @NotNull String key)
        Returns the singleton defined by this factory whose key is key, or null if no such singleton exists.
        Parameters:
        key - The singleton key to check for
        Returns:
        The singleton defined by this factory whose key is key, if one exists; otherwise, null

      • getOrFail

        @NotNull
public S getOrFail(@NotNull
                            @NotNull String key)
        Returns the singleton defined by this factory whose key is key, or throws a NoSuchSingletonException if no such singleton exists.
        Parameters:
        key - The singleton key to check for
        Returns:
        The singleton defined by this factory whose key is key, if one exists
        Throws:
        NoSuchSingletonException - If no such singleton exists

      • constructSingleton

        @ApiStatus.Internal
 @NotNull
protected abstract S constructSingleton(@NotNull
                                                                      @NotNull String key)
        Creates a new Singleton with the specified key.

        This method is for internal use only, to allow for the existence of custom Singleton and SingletonFactory implementations.

        Parameters:
        key - The string key of the new singleton
        Returns:
        The newly created Singleton

      • defineSingleton

        @ApiStatus.Internal
protected void defineSingleton(@NotNull
                                                   @NotNull String key,
                                                   @NotNull
                                                   S singleton)
        Defines the given key-singleton pair in this factory.

        The given singleton must have been created by this factory. In other words, Singleton.sharesFactoryWith(Singleton) should return true when run for any other singleton defined by this.

        This method is for internal use only, to allow for the existence of custom Singleton and SingletonFactory implementations.

        Parameters:
        key - The string key of the new singleton
        singleton - The new singleton instance

      • getOrDefine

        @NotNull
public S getOrDefine(@NotNull
                              @NotNull String key)
        Gets the singleton defined by this factory whose key is key, or defines a new singleton with that key if none exists.

        If a custom Singleton implementation permits additional data storage, then this method can be overridden to provide default values for that data or to remove an argument-free creation method altogether.

        Parameters:
        key - The key of the singleton to get
        Returns:
        The (possibly newly created) singleton whose key is key

      • remove

        @Nullable
public S remove(@NotNull
                          @NotNull String key)
        Removes the identified singleton from this factory, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the singleton to remove
        Returns:
        The removed singleton, if it exists; otherwise, null
        See Also:
        remove(Singleton)

      • remove

        @Nullable
public S remove(@NotNull
                          S singleton)
        Removes the identified singleton from this factory, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        singleton - The singleton instance to remove
        Returns:
        The removed singleton, if it exists; otherwise, null
        See Also:
        remove(String)
